name: jute production, irrigated | jute plant, harvested | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20413/documentation

Jute farming activity in India starts right after the harvest of the previous non-jute crops in the field. Jute farming covers soil preparation (fall tillage), inputs of seeds, application of mineral fertilizers, jute plant  harvesting. Two species of jute viz., Corchorus capsularis, known as white jute and Corchorus olitorius known as tossa/deshi jute belonging to the family Sparrmanniaceae, are being cultivated for fibre purpose. Jute is generally sown in February on lowlands and in March-May on uplands. The crop is harvested in about 110 days, but different varieties take different time to mature. The harvesting period generally ranges from July till October. ;Jute cultivation does not involve heavy doses of pesticides, however for better crop, manuring with farm yard manure and fertilizers is recommended. Usually, Jute crop can be grown in rain-fed and irrigated conditions both, but in irrigated condition, higher production can be obtained.;The dataset represents the production of 1 kg of jute plant in India in 2016. The farm has a yield of 40,000 kg fresh green matter per ha for this crop cycle. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 80-40-40 kg/ha. Organic fertilizer applied amounts to 5,000 kg/ha of manure from cattle dung. The activity covers soil preparation (fall tillage), inputs of seeds, mineral fertilizers, harvesting. Machinery and fixed overhead are excluded.;This dataset covers only the field activities for the production of jute. That means the technical boundary ends at the harvesting of the mature jute plant. The transformation of jute from the jute plant - the jute retting process - is covered in a separate dataset.

This activity starts right after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for the jute cultivation.

The activity ends at the harvesting of the mature jute plant.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0116:Growing of fibre crops

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for main crop: 15 April 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 15 Aug, 2016. Total harvesting time is approx 110 days.  Data is for one crop cycle. Cycle of one year considered for entry in ecoeditor
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Jute from conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The data on inputs to the field activites are collected directly from the farmers and farming experts. However, the emission data were not readily available for India. Hence, Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Focus group discussion, expert interviews, literature data and assumptions. Standardized questionnaires were developed and adapted to jute-specific cultivation and post-harvest situation. The secondary data from literature and the primary data from surveys were compared and matched to obtain highest data quality.

exchanges.description:
The output of the jute cultivation activity. Mature jute plant s harvested. Jute is generally harvested when the plants are at early pod stage. The harvest index remains more or less constant over 60–105 day period following sowing. However, it reaches its peak during 110-120 day period following sowing. 
The plants are usually cut close to the ground by hand. A curved, sickle type knife is used to cut the plants. The plants are then sorted out according to height and diameter. The assorted plants are tied into bundles. Each bundle weighs 8-10 kg. The bundles are kept standing in the field for 3–4 days for defoliation.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of jute plant, harvested is calculated to be circa 8.75E-05 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'benzimidazole-compound', 'pendimethalin'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.75E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Calculated Value. This value has been calculated by using the Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'jute plant, harvested' is calculated to be circa 6.85E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonia, liquid', 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'lime', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate rock, as P2O5, beneficiated, dry', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium fertiliser, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.37E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
